'''Tympole''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オタマロ''' ''Otamaro'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Palpitoad}} starting at [[level]] 25, which evolves into {{p|Seismitoad}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Tympole is a round, tadpole-like Pokémon with a tan, circular face. It has large, oval, black eyes, a wide mouth with down-turned corners, and black eyebrows in the shape of quarter notes. Its spherical body is black with no visible limbs. Instead, it has two black-and-blue ringed half-spheres on either side of its head. These spheres are vibrated to create a sound too high-pitched for humans to hear. The sounds are used in rhythm to communicate with others of its kind, particularly for warning of danger. It has a long, blue tail with a fan-like shape and a black spot at its base. The [[BW032|anime]] demonstrates that Tympole swims and attacks in groups.

==In the anime==
[[File:Tympole anime.png|thumb|230px|left|A school of Tympole in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Tympole debuted in ''[[BW032|Facing Fear with Eyes Wide Open!]]'', when a group of them attacked {{AP|Oshawott}} under water, under the command of a wild {{AP|Palpitoad}}. They were trying to prevent him from getting the medicine to cure the team from the poisoning several {{p|Foongus}} inflicted, but fled when Oshawott opened his eyes while using {{m|Razor Shell}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Tympole made a very minor cameo appearance near the end of ''[[BW045|Beheeyem, Duosion, and the Dream Thief!]]''.

Multiple Tympole appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]''.

A Tympole appeared in a flashback in ''[[BW101|Drayden Versus Iris: Past, Present, and Future!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:N Tympole Adventures.png|thumb|100px|left|Tympole in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{adv|N}} used a Tympole to battle {{adv|Black}} in Accumula Town in ''[[PS467|Letting Go]]''. He was eventually defeated by Black's [[Tep]].

A Tympole appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS518|True Friends]]''.

Multiple Tympole appeared in [[PS534]].

==Trivia==
* Tympole shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Poliwag}}, {{p|Poliwhirl}}, and {{p|Poliwrath}}. They are all known as the Tadpole Pokémon.
* Tympole's face has become a phenomenon on the popular Japanese online artist community {{wp|Pixiv}}.
* Although it is simulated as swimming in [[Pokédex 3D]], Tympole does not display the bubbles effect that all other Pokémon simulated in an aquatic environment, such as {{p|Eelektrik}} and {{p|Stunfisk}} display. The reason for this is unknown.

===Origin===
Tympole appears to be a combination of a toad tadpole and a loudspeaker. Tympole's spherical "speakers" were probably inspired by toads' "warts" and poison glands, as well as the {{wp|Surinam toad}}, an aquatic amphibian whose backs are covered in pockets that hold its eggs, or more likely, the {{wp|tympanum (anatomy)|tympanum}} of a real-life toad, located in the same area. It is an eardrum-like body part the toad uses to hear. Its Pokédex entry also mentions the fact that it creates vibrations underwater, also like the Surinam. Its eyebrows resemble {{wp|musical note}}s, specifically the quarter note, and the bumps on the side of its head are similar to {{wp|headphones}}.

====Name origin====
Tympole may be a combination of ''{{wp|timpani}}'' (a low-pitched drum-like sound or the sensation felt in the abdomen when a drum is struck), ''{{wp|tympani}}'' (a type of drum), or ''tympanic membrane'' ({{wp|eardrum}}; referring to the bumps on each side of its head), and ''{{wp|tadpole}}''. It may also involve ''tempo''.

Otamaro may be a combination of おたまじゃくし ''otamajakushi'' (''tadpole'' or ''musical notes'') and まろ ''maro'' (''an affectionate suffix'' or ''shaved eyebrows'', the latter referring to the markings above its eyes).
